intro: Marrubium incisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved horehound, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Marrubium incisum has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
